lead_paragraph: Candidates all over the country have hurled accusations of corruption at one another ahead of municipal and regional elections on Sunday.

byline.original: By KIRK SEMPLE and PAULINA VILLEGAS

headline.print_headline: Firebombs and Accusations Fly in ‘Ruthless’ Election Campaigns in Mexico
headline.main: Firebombs and Accusations Fly in ‘Ruthless’ Election Campaigns in Mexico

snippet: Candidates all over the country have hurled accusations of corruption at one another ahead of municipal and regional elections on Sunday.
abstract: Mexicans head to polls in tumultuous 2016 election cycle that includes choosing governors in 12 of 32 states; two-month campaign period has been most vitriolic in recent years, with candidates hurling accusations of corruption at each other.
